string-array.name: help_faq
string-array.item: FAQ 1: How user and/or group management work in Peon?
FAQ 2: How can I manage groups?
FAQ 3: How can I manage users?
FAQ 5: How schedules work in Peon?
FAQ 6: How messaging works in Peon?

string-array.name: help_ans
string-array.item:
Answer: 
 There are some stages in Peon in which the capabilities of a role of subscriber is distributed.
 1. You can manage only groups if you are an organization/institute admin, such as adding new groups.
 2. You can manage only users (group members) if you are a group admin, such as inviting a user to the group.
 3. You can not manage users unless you are invited to be a group admin by current group admin.

Answer: 
 You can manage group by going to the 'Create Group' menu to create a new group. Also, you can view current groups in 'View Groups' menu. Currently, deleting and/or editing a group is not available in Peon. You can contact us if you willing to do so. 

Note that: 'Create Group' and 'View Groups' menu are ONLY available to an organization/institute admin.

Answer: 
 You can manage users by going to the 'Manage Users' menu and select 'Add user' to invite a new user or admin to the group. Also, you can view current groups in 'Manage Users' menu. Currently, deleting and/or editing a user is not available in Peon. You can contact us if you willing to do so. 

Note that: 'Manage Users' menu is ONLY available to a group admin.
Answer: \n \'Dashboard\' menu is ONLY available to the organization/institute admin. It represents the details about created groups and users under the organization/institute.
Answer: \n Schedules can be posted by ONLY a group admin and can be viewed by group members.
Answer: \n Only the members of same group can message each other. A group\'s member cannot send messages to other group member.
